BE
RESOLVED,
That the
Mayer and the Clerk of the Board
of Supervisors are hereby author-
ized and directed to execute, in be-
half of the City and County of San
Francisco, duplicate counterparts
of proposed agreement between
Southern Pacific Company, a corpo-
ration, called
"Licensor and City
and County of San Francisco, a
municipal corporation, called
censee," permitting the City the
right to construct, maintain and
operate a three-inch (3") water pipe
line beneath the Southern Pacific
Company's right of wav near Lo-
mita Park, in the County of San
Mateo. State of California, to be
used in connection with the Muni-
cipal Air Port.
Adopted- -Board of Supervisors,
San Francisco, March 28, 1927.
Ayes: Supervisors Byington, Col-
man
Havenner, Hayden, Kent.
Marks, McSheehy, Powers, Schmidt,
Shannon, Stanton, Todd.
Absent:
Supervisors
Badaracco,
Bath, Deasy, Gallagher, Harrelson,
Roncovieri
J. S. DUNNIGAN, Clerk.
Approved San Francisco, April 8,
1927
apr9-1t

Resolution No. 27075 (New Series).
Upon recommendation of the City
Engineer,
BE IT RESOLVED that
the Mayor and the
Clerk of the
Board of
Supervisors are hereby
authorized and directed to execute
in behalf of the City and County of
San
Francisco, duplicate counter-
parts of proposed agreement be-
tween
MARKET STREET
RAIL-
WAY COMPANY. a corporation. the
Paid cothe firso part, and CAN
SAN
FRAN-
CISCO, a municipal corporation, the
party of the second part, permitting
the
City the right to construct,
maintain and operate a three-inch
(3") water pipe line beneath the
Market Street Railway Company's
street car tracks near Lomita Park,
in the County of San Mateo, State
of California, to be used in connec-
tion with the Municipal Air Port.
Adonted _- Board of Supervisors,
San Francisco, April 4, 1927.
Aves: Supervisors Byington, Col-
man, Deasy, Gallagher, Harrelson,
Havenner, Hayden, Kent.
Marks.
MeSheehy.

Todd.

Bath.
